author: trawick
msg: ap_close() now calls ap_flush() for buffered files, so write
operations work a whole lot better on buffered files :)

author: gstein
msg: Can't add anything to a void*. Make it a char* for these manipulations.

author: gstein
msg: A string constant was straddling a newline. Badness.
(separate fix by Greg: #if an Apache function call out of existence, and
optimize the function by computing length once and memcpy'ing)

author: trawick
msg: Remove const from ap_socket_t parameters on APR functions so that
APR can modify the ap_socket_t as it sees fit.  It may choose to
modify the ap_socket_t on functions which only read from the ap_socket_t
arg to one of the changed functions, so const was removed there also.
